metadata.title: POST 30 10

config.question: Which of these hindered the Kennedy administration’s efforts to secure southern black voting rights?

choices.content: lack of federal protection for voters
lack of support from the SNCC
widespread riots and protests in the South
African Americans’ inability to pass literacy tests

answer_3.response: In two years, the Kennedy administration increased the number of voting rights suits fivefold. Yet the attorney general could not force the FBI to protect the civil rights volunteers who risked their lives by encouraging African Americans to register.

answer_2.response: In two years, the Kennedy administration increased the number of voting rights suits fivefold. Yet the attorney general could not force the FBI to protect the civil rights volunteers who risked their lives by encouraging African Americans to register.

answer_1.response: In two years, the Kennedy administration increased the number of voting rights suits fivefold. Yet the attorney general could not force the FBI to protect the civil rights volunteers who risked their lives by encouraging African Americans to register.
